Curfew In Manipur's Kangpokpi Amid Tension Between Naga, Kuki-Zo Communities - NDTV
summary:
Curfew In Manipur's Kangpokpi Amid Tension Between Naga, Kuki-Zo Communities

Publication Date: January 7, 2023 Source: NDTV

A curfew was imposed in the Kangpokpi district of Manipur following escalating tensions between the Naga and Kuki-Zo communities over a territorial dispute.

  • A curfew was enacted by District Magistrate Mahesh Chaudhari due to increased tensions.
  • Disputes arose over claims to territory between Konsakhul and Leilon Vaiphei villages.
  • Minor clashes occurred, but no injuries were reported.
  • A separate incident involved the destruction of an Assam Rifles camp in Kamjong district.
  • The Assam Rifles were accused of imposing restrictions on timber transportation.
No injuries were reported in the clashes.

This situation reflects ongoing tensions in the region, underscoring the volatility surrounding territorial claims and community relations.
newTitle: Curfew Imposed in Manipur's Kangpokpi Due to Community Tensions

As Dhananjay Munde row continues to spiral in Maharashtra, BJP keeps a watch, Delhi takes note - The Indian Express
summary:
Tensions Rise in Maharashtra Over Dhananjay Munde's Alleged Involvement in Murder Case

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Indian Express

The ongoing Beed murder case involving Dhananjay Munde's aide is escalating political tensions in Maharashtra, with growing calls for Munde's resignation amid questions about the investigation's integrity.

  • The murder of Massajog sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh has led to potential political fallout for NCP Food Minister Dhananjay Munde.
  • Six arrests made by CID connected to the murder, with political opposition demanding further accountability.
  • Munde faces serious allegations from his sister-in-law regarding coerced land transactions.
  • Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis asserts commitment to investigating all angles of the case.
  • BJP leadership in Delhi is closely monitoring the situation and may require Munde's resignation if evidence is substantiated.
“We will hold demonstrations across Maharashtra till justice is given to the sarpanch’s family members.” - Manoj Jarange Patil

The saga surrounding Munde may influence caste dynamics within the state, potentially complicating the coalition government's standing.
newTitle: Tensions Rise in Maharashtra Over Dhananjay Munde's Alleged Involvement in Murder Case

23 Workers Injured After Under-Construction Building Of Kannauj Railway Station Collapses - News18
summary:
23 Workers Injured After Under-Construction Building Of Kannauj Railway Station Collapses

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: News18

Over two dozen workers were trapped after an under-construction roof slab of the Kannauj railway station collapsed on Saturday afternoon, resulting in at least 23 injuries, with three being serious and twenty suffering minor injuries.

  • The roof slab collapse occurred around 2:39 PM during beautification work after the shuttering failed.
  • Rescue teams, including the National Disaster Response Force, were deployed promptly.
  • Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed local officials to ensure the safe recovery of all trapped workers.
  • An ex-gratia payment of ₹50,000 for grievous injuries and ₹5,000 for other injuries was announced.
  • Political leaders expressed concern, with Akhilesh Yadav calling for government accountability regarding safety standards during construction.
“The incident that took place in Kannauj is very sad… Safety should have been maintained during the construction, which was neglected and this incident took place.” - Akhilesh Yadav

This incident highlights ongoing concerns regarding construction safety standards in the region.
newTitle: 23 Workers Injured After Under-Construction Building Of Kannauj Railway Station Collapses

Former Chief Minister's Son, Ex AAP Minister On BJP's 2nd List For Delhi Polls - NDTV
summary:
BJP Announces Second List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections

Publication Date: January 6, 2023 Source: New Delhi

With less than a month remaining for the Delhi Assembly elections, the BJP has unveiled its second list featuring 29 candidates including notable figures like Kapil Mishra and Harish Khurana.

  • BJP has named Kapil Mishra to contest from Karawal Nagar.
  • Harish Khurana, son of former Chief Minister Madan Lal Khurana, will contest from Moti Nagar.
  • Karnail Singh will challenge AAP's Satyendar Jain from Shakur Basti.
  • Only one sitting MLA, Mohan Singh Bisht, has been dropped from his constituency.
  • The list includes five women candidates, increasing the total to seven.
  • 58 out of 70 Assembly seats have been announced by the BJP for the upcoming elections.
  • Delhi will vote on February 5, with results to be declared on February 8.
“Mr Mishra joined the BJP in 2019 and made headlines after referring to CAA protest sites as 'mini-Pakistans.'”

The BJP's candidate strategy seeks to compete against AAP, which announced its candidates in advance.
newTitle: BJP Announces Second List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections

Delhi polls: Kejriwals big claim on BJPs CM face; Amit Shah hits back - The Tribune India
summary:
Delhi Elections: Kejriwal Alleges BJP's CM Candidate, Amit Shah Responds

Date: February 5, 2023 - Source: The Tribune

AAP Chief Arvind Kejriwal claims BJP will announce Ramesh Bidhuri as their chief ministerial candidate, while Amit Shah labels it a political tactic.

  • Kejriwal asserts BJP's CM candidate will be Ramesh Bidhuri.
  • Amit Shah dismisses Kejriwal's claim as a rumor.
  • Kejriwal challenges Bidhuri to a public debate.
  • Delhi Assembly elections scheduled for February 5, 2023.
  • Atishi seeks reelection from Kalkaji seat against Bidhuri.
“Yes, we are challenging the BJP to a debate,” said Arvind Kejriwal.

The upcoming elections will see the AAP aiming for a third consecutive term, while the BJP fights to increase its presence in the assembly.
newTitle: Delhi Elections: Kejriwal Alleges BJP's CM Candidate, Amit Shah Responds

title: Delhi election: Amit Shah says Sheesh Mahal's toilet expensive than slums; Arvind Kejriwal takes ‘lied’ dig - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi election: Amit Shah accused Arvind Kejriwal of deceiving slum dwellers and turning Delhi into a "living hell".

Publication Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Amit Shah, speaking at a conference for slum dwellers, criticized Arvind Kejriwal for the poor conditions in Delhi's slums, stating that the toilet in Kejriwal's 'Sheesh Mahal' is more expensive than basic housing for slum residents. Kejriwal responded, asserting that the people of Delhi will retaliate against Shah's remarks in the upcoming elections.

  • Amit Shah claims Kejriwal has deprived slum dwellers of basic utilities like clean water.
  • Shah accuses AAP's policies of turning Delhi into a "living hell".
  • Kejriwal counters that residents will respond to Shah's criticism with their votes.
  • Shah cites PM Modi's housing program, indicating over 3.58 crore homes provided to the poor.
"Today, I'm saying to the AAP--they have become a disaster for the people of Delhi." - Amit Shah

The exchange between the two political leaders highlights the ongoing contention leading up to the Delhi elections, with both sides prepared to leverage the housing and slum conditions as key issues in their campaigns.
newTitle: Delhi Election: Amit Shah Critiques Kejriwal Over Slum Conditions

'Mandir banane se kya hoga ... ': Amit Shah mocks Kejriwal; watch video - The Times of India
summary:
'Mandir banane se kya hoga ... ': Amit Shah mocks Kejriwal; watch video

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Amit Shah recently made headlines by mocking Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal regarding the construction of temples. The remarks sparked discussions across social media platforms.

  • Shah's comments were made during a public address.
  • The political context involves ongoing tensions between the BJP and AAP.
  • Many social media users reacted to Shah's statements, creating a buzz on various platforms.
"Kya mandir banane se Kejriwal ko kuch fayda hoga?" - Amit Shah

This statement highlights Shah's position on the efficacy of such projects in the context of governance.

The ongoing political rivalry continues to influence public sentiment and political discourse in Delhi.
newTitle: 'Mandir banane se kya hoga ... ': Amit Shah mocks Kejriwal; watch video
